steps: Show a puzzle from Level 1 and have students discuss what they notice.
Discuss how they know how many cups or pints to select.
Show puzzles from Level 2. Discuss how these puzzles compare to the puzzles in Level 1.
Play puzzles in each level and discuss how the different units compare (i.e., cups, pints, quarts, gallons).
Have students write equations to represent the relationship between the different units.

standardDescription: 4.MD.A.1: Know relative sizes of measurement units within one system of units including km, m, cm; kg, g; lb, oz.; l, ml; hr, min, sec. Within a single system of measurement, express measurements in a larger unit in terms of a smaller unit. Record measurement equivalents in a two-column table. For example, know that 1 ft is 12 times as long as 1 in. Express the length of a 4 ft snake as 48 in. Generate a conversion table for feet and inches listing the number pairs (1, 12), (2, 24), (3, 36), ...
